title: Sean Paul praises Beyonce for Baby Boy legacy as he teases Alicia Keys collab
text:
Sean Paul heaped praise on Beyonce after their Baby Boy collaboration (Picture: PA)

Sean Paul has been in the music industry for decades, bursting into the mainstream with Gimme The Light, from his second album Dutty Rock.

But there is one particular song the 46-year-old is mostly known for – his epic collaboration with Beyonce on Baby Boy back in 2003.

Side note: 16 years later, the track is still a total banger.

And the Get Busy star has lifted the lid on the legacy of the single, praising Bey for shining a huge light on dancehall music.

Speaking to Metro.co.uk at the Kiss Haunted House party, he told us: ‘Someone said the other day the song is almost 20 years old, it’s crazy.

‘I loved the feeling that I was even picked to do the song, because I didn’t come up with the concept.

‘She just heard me, and my stuff was popping off at the time, and she’s like, “I want that dude to come and do something on the track.”

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It was very good timing for me, and also just a great thing for her to help dancehall move to another level.’

The song came out way back in 2003 and is still a firm favourite (Picture: PA)

As well as Beyonce, Sean has worked with some of the biggest names in music, scoring hits with Rihanna, Little Mix, Sia and Blu Cantrell.

But there is one singer he is still desperate to get in the studio with – Alicia Keys.

‘We were supposed to do a song and we got stuck in the mix,’ he continued.

Sean wants to get Alicia Keys in the studio next (Picture: FilmMagic)

‘We haven’t kept up with each other, so I’d love to finish the song.’

But Sean might need to hit pause on that, as he’s due to hit the road with Shaggy for a 2020 tour of Australia.

Does the man ever rest?

‘We’ve been friends for quite a few years in the business,’ he said. ‘We’ve worked together on songs, we’ve done shows before, and tours before. He has a big charity that he does in Jamaica, for a children’s hospital.

‘It’s not unfamiliar thing for us to do. I’m looking forward to it.’

And the Like Glue star is already predicting some wild nights out with his pal, adding: ‘Probably. I haven’t seen him or partied with him in a long time, so yeah!’

description: Sean Paul praises Beyonce for Baby Boy legacy 16 years after song was released as he teases Alicia Keys collaboration
